title: MicroQuickJS as a robust sandboxing environment for LLM-generated code
description: Simon Willison explores using MicroQuickJS (Fabrice Bellard's new 100KB JavaScript engine for embedded systems) as a sandboxing solution for executing untrusted code from LLMs. The engine has robust memory and time limits baked in, doesn't expose dangerous primitives like filesystem or network access, and even has a regex engine that protects against exhaustion attacks. Simon used Claude Code to investigate Python bindings, WebAssembly compilation, and testing across Node.js, Deno, and Pyodide.
author: Simon Willison

title: Cooking with Claude: vibe-coding custom applications
description: Simon describes using LLMs for cooking tasks, progressing from basic recipes to advanced applications. He had Claude vibe-code a custom application to help with timing for complicated meal preparation. This demonstrates how AI coding assistants are becoming useful for domains far beyond traditional software development.
author: Simon Willison

title: First success using Claude in Chrome browser agent
description: Simon successfully used the Claude in Chrome extension to solve a real problem - finding a Cloudflare configuration for CORS headers. Despite being skeptical of browser agents due to prompt injection risks, he found the 1m45s session very effective. The agent navigated the Cloudflare dashboard and found the Response Header Transform Rule configuration.
author: Simon Willison

title: uv-init-demos: Exploring uv init options
description: Simon created a GitHub repository demonstrating all the different options of uv's init command (--app, --package, --lib), generated using a Claude Code prompt and scheduled to run via GitHub Actions to capture changes from future releases.
author: Simon Willison

title: Claude Code is coming to Slack integration
description: Anthropic is launching Claude Code in Slack, allowing developers to delegate coding tasks directly from chat threads. This integration represents a significant expansion of Claude Code's accessibility and workflow integration.
author: TechCrunch

title: WordPress's Telex vibe-coding experiment sees real-world use
description: WordPress's experimental AI development tool, Telex, has been put to real-world use only months after its September debut. The tool exemplifies the growing trend of vibe-coding in major software projects.
author: TechCrunch

title: Claude Opus 4.5 reclaims coding crown from Gemini 3
description: Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.5 achieves 80.9% on SWE-Bench Verified coding benchmark, reclaiming the top position for coding tasks. The model is 67% cheaper than previous versions and is now available in Claude Code for Pro users. Released November 24, 2025.
author: Anthropic / The New Stack

title: Hacker News: The State of AI Coding Report 2025
description: Discussion on the State of AI Coding Report 2025, with comments noting that if AI tools are making teams 76% faster with 100% more bugs, teams aren't more productive - they're just punting more technical debt.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Hacker News: By what percentage has AI changed your output?
description: Ask HN discussion requesting developers to quantify productivity changes compared to ~2 years ago before AI coding tools became prevalent. Community discussion on real-world impact of AI coding assistants.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Vibe coding enters mainstream lexicon
description: Wikipedia officially recognizes 'vibe coding' as an AI-assisted software development technique. The term was introduced by Andrej Karpathy in February 2025 and has rapidly gained adoption across the AI development community.
author: Wikipedia / Andrej Karpathy

title: Google AI Studio launches Vibe Code with Gemini
description: Google AI Studio introduces 'Vibe Code with Gemini', a platform promising to turn ideas into functional, shareable apps with AI features built-in by default. The platform aims to go from 'Prompt to Product' using vibe-coding techniques.
author: Google AI Studio
